body.p:
Greenupsburg Ky
October 10th 1861
To his Excellency
Beriah Mcgoffin Governor of The Commonwealth of Kentucky.
Dear Sir

At the November Term of the Greenup Circuit Court 1861. One John W. Prince was fine Seventy or Seventy five Dollars for an assault commited upon One Prater. Hugh Craycraft became the Security, of Prince & will have the money to pay unless your Executive clemency Shall interpose & release him of the payment of the Same. Except costs & commonwealth Attorney fees Mr Craycraft is a clever gentlemen in humble circumstances, but owning to the unfortunate condition of the country, it is impossible to collect money -- and if his property is suffered to sell at this time, it would break him up. and then in all probability would not pay the debt. please give this matter due consideration. And if from the facts that will be made known to you your Excellency should remit the fine -- please Extend the time of payment. Yours with very Great respect

To his Excellency
Beriah Mcgoffin
Governor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky.

Greenup Cir. Ct
$670 } Assault
Jno. W. Price
Issd Octo 26 1861
